sentences.sContent: This is our room, and yours is just across the hall.
sentences.sCn: 这是我们的房间，你们的在走廊那边。

sentences.sContent: A lot of people have money problems, but yours are more serious than most people’s.
sentences.sCn: 许多人有财务问题，不过你的问题比大多数人的要严重。

sentences.sContent: A cash prize of £10,000 or a new car – the choice is yours.
sentences.sCn: 一万英镑的奖金或一辆新车——随你选择。

trans.tranCn: 你（们）的东西；你的责任[义务]；你的家属；来信，尊函
trans.tranOther: used when speaking or writing to one or more people to refer to something that belongs to them or is connected with them

trans.tranCn: 你（们）的（东西）；信末署名前用语
